items.title: AC Milan to host Serie A match in Perth in what UEFA says is a 'regrettable' situation
items.summary: AC Milan will host a Serie A match in Perth next year, as UEFA's hand appears to have been forced to allow the game to go ahead.

items.title: Ord Valley's northern food bowl 'pipe dream' struggles amid changing climate

items.title: 'Deeply wrong' pro-Hamas graffiti condemned as Australian Jewish community marks October 7
items.summary: Political leaders have condemned the painting of a pro-Hamas slogan on a Melbourne billboard as Australia's Jewish community commemorates the October 7 terrorist attack.

items.title: With an all-Blak writing team, Erica Glynn brought Mystery Road: Origin's enigmatic detective Jay Swan to life
items.summary: With the help of Mystery Road: Origin's steely detective Jay Swan, an all-Indigenous writing team tackles one of Australia's biggest issues.

items.title: Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre has reached its peak and is beginning to evaporate, local pilot says
items.summary: The floodwaters that have created an expansive inland oasis on the usually arid salt beds of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre have reached a peak, and are beginning to evaporate, a local pilot says.

items.title: AFL trade period, day two updates: Rival clubs reportedly interested in luring Nick Daicos away from Collingwood, Carlton secure Liam Reidy
items.summary: The reported attempts to lure Nick Daicos away from Collingwood have headlined the second day of the AFL trade period. Look back at how all the day's trade news unfolded in our blog.

items.title: Search for missing man Peter Willoughby, 76, continues in Tasmanian bushland
items.summary: Mounted crews and drones are now involved in the search for Peter Willoughby, 76, who became disoriented and walked off into dense bushland near Launceston, police say.

items.title: Woman claiming to be Madeleine McCann on trial charged with stalking parents
items.summary: A 24-year-old woman who claims to be Madeleine McCann is on trial charged with stalking the missing child's parents over the past three years.

items.title: New WA program aims to improve access to childcare for children with disabilities
items.summary: An Australian-first pilot program gets underway in WA in the hope of not only giving the parents of children with complex needs a break, but helping them navigate the maze of different support systems.

items.title: Janine Vaughan's family call for billboard to be uncovered ahead of Bathurst 1000
items.summary: With more than 200,000 people expected to attend this weekend's Bathurst 1000, the family of Janine Vaughan wants a billboard raising awareness about her disappearance uncovered.

items.title: Bayer announces Roundup alternative with rollout of new weedkiller in Australia
items.summary: We've been spraying it on our farms, gardens and roadsides for 50 years, but the world's most used weedkiller is starting to run out of steam.

items.title: Daria Kasatkina ends 2025 tennis season early, citing burnout
items.summary: Daria Kasatkina ends her 2025 WTA season early, citing the hectic schedule and a high-stress year after switching nationalities to Australia from Russia.

items.title: Wildlife photographer Rob Blakers pleads guilty to trespassing on Robbins Island
items.summary: Wildlife photographer Rob Blakers pleads guilty to trespassing after admitting he camped beyond the boundary line whilst visiting privately owned Robbins Island to observe migratory birds.

items.title: Darwin ship lift project cost blowout rivalling Snowy 2.0, economist says
items.summary: It’s taken 10 years, blown out by hundreds of millions of dollars, and is still nowhere near becoming operational. Now there are calls for the Darwin ship lift project to be scrapped.

items.title: Drought conditions forcing kangaroo mobs to descend on farms, consuming scarce resources
items.summary: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

items.title: Singapore PM Lawrence Wong signals 'shared interests' with Australia and desire to expand military ties
items.summary: Singapore wants to expand its military ties with Australia, including through a greater Australian troop presence in the island state as part of an upgraded trade and defence relationship, according to Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.

items.title: Bulk-billing rates remain low as GPs spend longer with patients, survey finds
items.summary: An industry survey finds GPs are managing conditions typically handled by specialists due to high costs and only 12 per cent can afford to bulk-bill all patients.

items.title: Songbird heard for first time since 1890s in WA park
items.summary: The song of the noisy scrub-bird is being heard in WA's West Cape Howe National Park again, bringing joy to bird enthusiasts everywhere.

items.title: Victorian couple sues Barwon Health over delayed diagnosis of rare 'flesh-eating disease' necrotising fasciitis
items.summary: A young father who lost his eye after contracting a rare infection is suing the hospital that treated him, alleging it ignored his requests to investigate his condition properly.

items.title: Expert cautions people using AI as search for missing boy in SA outback scaled back
items.summary: Users have reported Facebook's AI search has shown incorrect information about four-year-old Gus who remains missing in SA's outback.

items.title: What the future holds for Sydney's former psychiatric hospital sites with storied pasts

items.title: Sole survivor of Bochara fatal crash was behind the wheel, coroner rules

items.title: Sussan Ley cites trans offender case in argument for minimum jail terms for child exploitation crimes

items.title: New data shows Australia's extreme weather losses among highest in world

items.title: Two years since Gaza war began, some Israelis feel 'reckoning' is coming
items.summary: After two years of war, a fractured but defiant Israel is struggling to assert itself at home and abroad.

items.title: TasTAFE to remove subsidy for lab training, design, media and courses that 'don't align with jobs market'
items.summary: Tasmanian TAFE graduates worry as some locally taught courses that helped them forge a career may disappear as the cost to study them increases dramatically.

items.title: At least 63 people killed in Indonesia school collapse disaster in Java
items.summary: The number of people killed in the disaster could still rise, with some half a dozen children still unaccounted for.

items.title: Trio of scientists win Nobel Prize in Medicine for 'discoveries concerning peripheral immune tolerance'

items.title: English author Jilly Cooper, writer of The Rutshire Chronicles, dies at age 88

items.title: Perth Royal Show attendance slumps to eight-year low

items.title: York family honours late son with tractor museum to fund cancer research

items.title: Homeschool registrations are rising and policy needs to catch up
